title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel set an Olympic record with three shutouts in a single women's hockey tournament.
Team USA beat Sweden 5-0 in the semifinals, with Frankel saving all 21 shots.
USA has five consecutive shutouts and will face Canada in the gold-medal game.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died after falling through ice at First Encounter Beach in Eastham on February 14, local officials reported.
Her husband is missing and presumed to have fallen through the ice earlier; search for him has been suspended.
Emergency teams, including divers and drones, searched but did not locate the husband; names withheld per family's request.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded from the Red Sox to the Giants in June 2025 after disagreements over his position.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner expressed disappointment in Devers' unwillingness to play first base following an injury.
Red Sox management admitted they might have handled the situation differently leading up to Devers' trade.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox President Sam Kennedy addressed criticism about the team's commitment to winning by emphasizing the importance of winning games.
Rafael Devers was traded after a failed position change, and Alex Bregman later signed with the Cubs.
The Red Sox's 2026 luxury tax payroll is projected at $256.1 million, seventh-highest in MLB, underscoring financial commitment.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured after shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people, including the suspected shooter, were killed during a shooting at Lynch Arena in Pawtucket, R.I.
The incident during a high school hockey game stemmed from a 'targeted family dispute', according to Mayor Donald Grebien.
Three additional individuals sustained critical injuries; police are investigating the connection between victims and the shooter.

title: Jaylen Brown calls out city of Beverly Hills for shutting down his All-Star Weekend event
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown's All-Star Weekend event in Beverly Hills was shut down by police due to a permit issue.
Brown disputes the city’s claim about the permit, stating the event was allowed by mansion owner James Jannard.
The shutdown led to significant financial loss, and Brown criticized the city’s explanation as false and offensive.

title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez were sentenced for stealing and fraudulently depositing checks from the mail.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and Baez received two years, both with additional supervised release terms.
The scheme involved altering checks stolen from USPS boxes, which were then deposited into controlled bank accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen detained by ICE, invited to 2026 State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes, originally from Brazil, was detained in May 2025 while heading to volleyball practice due to expired student visa.
Gomes' arrest led to community protests; he and Rep. Moulton highlight systemic issues in the US immigration process.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark at the Olympics.
The Boston Bruins goaltender humorously addressed his performance, citing colorblindness amid speculation about visibility issues.
Team USA proceeded with confidence as Swayman made 18 stops; other top goalies are available for future games.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum's potential return from an Achilles injury is creating buzz among NBA players and legends at the All-Star event.
Kevin Durant, having experienced a similar recovery, expects Tatum to play at an All-Star level upon his return.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's strategic reintegration could make the Celtics a formidable playoff team.
